k5 0.0.1
  • Reference
  • Changelog

k5

The goal of ‘k5’ is to offer miscellaneous quality of life functions used by Kiernan Nicholls during interactive programming. Many of the functions simply to bring commonly used functions more in line with the tidyverse style.

Installation

You can install the development version of ‘k5’ from GitHub:

# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("kiernann/k5")

Example

library(fs)
library(k5)
library(readr)

The zip_*() functions use utils::zip() but return data like fs::file_*().

z <- file_temp(ext = "zip")
t %>% # can easily pipe into
  zip_create(z, junk = FALSE)
zip_info(z)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 3
#>   path                        size date               
#>   <fs::path>           <fs::bytes> <dttm>             
#> 1 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/A.txt      17.15K 2020-11-12 21:59:00
#> 2 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/B.txt      15.36K 2020-11-12 21:59:00
#> 3 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/C.txt        5.5K 2020-11-12 21:59:00
#> 4 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/D.txt       8.44K 2020-11-12 21:59:00
#> 5 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/E.txt       2.21K 2020-11-12 21:59:00
zip_size(z)
#> deflated: 48.6K, compressed: 24.5K (50.36%)
zip_move(z, tempdir())

Compare this to the output of the utils::unzip() and other base versions.

zip(z, t)
file.size(z)
#> [1] 25086
unzip(z, list = TRUE)
#>                   Name Length                Date
#> 1 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/A.txt  17557 2020-11-12 21:59:00
#> 2 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/B.txt  15724 2020-11-12 21:59:00
#> 3 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/C.txt   5627 2020-11-12 21:59:00
#> 4 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/D.txt   8643 2020-11-12 21:59:00
#> 5 tmp/RtmpsYA89A/E.txt   2264 2020-11-12 21:59:00
unzip(z, exdir = tempdir())
